aiofauna.server module

REST API Module with automatic OpenAPI generation.

class aiofauna.server.APIServer(*args, title: str = 'AioFauna', servers: list[str] | None = None, description: str = 'AioFauna API', version: str = '0.0.1', openapi_url: str = '/openapi.json', **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Application

AioFauna APIServer class for handling API operations.

Parameters:

  • title (str) – The title of the API.

  • servers (list[str]) – List of server URLs.

  • description (str) – API description.

  • version (str) – API version.

  • openapi_url (str) – URL for OpenAPI documentation.

sse(path: str) → Callable[[Callable[[P], Awaitable[EventSourceResponse]]], Callable[[P], Awaitable[EventSourceResponse]]][source]

Server-Sent Events decorator.

Parameters:

path (str) – The API path for the SSE request.

Returns:

Decorated function for handling the SSE request.

This decorator will handle SSE connections and pass the response object to the decorated function, be sure to include a parameter with the type annotation EventSourceResponse in your function signature. You can use the send method of the response object to send events to the client.

Example:

import asyncio from aiofauna import FaunaClient, APIServer, EventSourceResponse, to_json,q

app = APIServer() fauna = FaunaClient()

@app.sse(“/stream”) async def stream(sse: EventSourceResponse):

while True:

now = await fauna.query(q.now()) await sse.send(to_json(now[“@ts”])) await asyncio.sleep(1)

static() → APIServer[source]

Static files decorator.

This decorator will serve static files from the static directory. It will also serve the index.html file from the static directory when the root path is requested. Useful for serving a frontend single-page application.

Returns:

The server instance.

use(router: APIRouter, prefix: str = '') → APIServer[source]

Chainable method to add a router to the server

websocket(path: str) → Callable[[Callable[[P], Awaitable[WebSocketResponse]]], Callable[[P], Awaitable[WebSocketResponse]]][source]

Websocket decorator.

Parameters:

path (str) – The API path for the websocket request.

Returns:

Decorated function for handling the websocket request.

This decorator will handle websocket connections and pass the websocket object to the decorated function, be sure to include a parameter with the type annotation WebSocketResponse in your function signature and also setup proper error handling, since PING and PONG messages are handled automatically by the server and will result on a MessageTypeError if not handled.
